author: litosandoval
text: I’d say to UDC you can do better, but after three years of existence and noticing their history of disingenuous tactics, clearly they can’t.  /16 - el fin

author: litosandoval
text: So let’s be real here.  The event was not canceled because UDC had a sudden moment of wokeness, it was because their moderator and event co-sponsor pulled out.  /15

author: litosandoval
text: - Manny then posted:  “I just called the UDC president and told them that I wouldn't be participating in the event.”  He did mention they would issue an apology.   /14

author: litosandoval
text: - The FB event then had the “Politicos Picantes” text and image removed, which shows the event was looking to be rebranded or was a stop gap measure while an action plan was formulated. /13

author: litosandoval
text: - From Manny after he was tagged by Wendy Aragon:  “I just saw this bc… [Wendy] …tagged me and I immediately called and have asked them to take this down and come up with a new name and marketing. i agree - I don't think this is appropriate.” /12

author: litosandoval
text:
In addition, it tries to put a smokescreen over what really happened in regards to the cancellation:
/11

author: litosandoval
text:
And now last night.  
This non-apology is one of those “oops we got caught” apologies that takes no personal responsibility for what actually happened in the creation and naming of the actual event.  /10

author: litosandoval
text: I replied to their tweet : “Harry Britt stood for everything your club is not. UDC is the opposite of Harry's legacy. What a disingenuous load-of-crap tweet from y'all!” Others had replies too.  The tweet was deleted within the hour of posting /9

author: litosandoval
text: After Harry Britt passed this summer, UDC tweeted something along the lines of “We are the legacy of Harry Britt”  Da fuq you say??

author: litosandoval
text: See the deception there? Shades of  Jaida Essence Hall’s “Look over there!” /7

author: litosandoval
text: UDC was originally called the Robert F. Kennedy Democratic Club but changed their name after the Kennedy family sent them a letter to not use the family name.  /6

author: litosandoval
text: I do not accept the United Democratic Club of San Francisco’s apology for their event.  Nor should any Latina/o/x person.  UDC are masters of spin when it comes to not taking accountability. /5

author: litosandoval
text: As soon as this was flagged, we removed the event immediately to avoid any further hurt. Being inclusive, open and accessible to every San Franciscan is something that we are wholeheartedly committed to. We promise to do better going forward.” /4

author: litosandoval
text: UDC eventually put out a weak-sauce apology:  “To our Latinx members and Latinx community here in San Francisco: the United Democratic Club apologizes and is deeply sorry for the lack of cultural sensitivity in the planning and promotion of one of our events. /3

author: litosandoval
text: with an image of chiles burning in a vessel como burning copal.  The event description was a textbook example of cultural appropriation:  spicy, picante, etc.  The FB event has since been deleted although the renamed event still exists on UDC’s calendar. /2

author: litosandoval
text: Last night I was made aware of an event by the United Democratic Club of San Francisco by a friend who avoids political clubs and political drama.  The event was a conversation between Manny Yekutiel and State Senator Scott Wiener called “Politicos Picantes:  Spice for a Cause” https://t.co/tpCojXo3qq

author: litosandoval
text: You can view the conversation and hear some great stories here: https://t.co/RTu5mIZZIZ It should be appearing on YouTube soon too.

author: litosandoval
text: I think one thing we left out is that many younger queer activists and even not-so-young ones have an appreciation of ACT UP now and what we did back then. But at the time, we definitely were not approved of across the board.

author: litosandoval
text: CBS got footage of me getting arrested. I used to work at a school. The next day students brought up they saw me on TV. My Director knew, he was gay and HIV positive, but didn't say anything. After that we did a weekend conference, he showed up let me know he knew and thanked me.

author: litosandoval
text: I was 22 yo and the Recording Secretary of ACT UP and part of the Local Issues Committee. I left out the anecdote that I called in sick to work on the day of the Local Issue- focused demonstration.

author: litosandoval
text: I always feel like I never have anything profound to say at these things. And, of course, after it's over are the shoulda couldas of things left out. Oh well, at least my shirt was cute.

author: litosandoval
text: when ACT UPs from all over the world converged in San Francisco and held a week of demonstrations culminating with the group shouting down the Bush Administration's Secretary of Health and Human Services Louis Sullivan.

author: litosandoval
text:
May 27, Titi Gulley in Portland, OR
May 31, Malcolm Harsch in Victorville, CA
June 9, Dominique Alexander in New York City, NY
June 10, Robert Fuller in Palmdale, CA 

Four Black people found hanging in trees in the last 3 weeks. Each ruled a suicide by authorities. 

Bullshit.

author: litosandoval
text: She described herself as "...someone who is not aware of the damage caused by being ignorant and naive to racial inequalities. "  Woman, have you been blind all your life? author: litosandoval
text: HA HA  People demanding an apology.  The person(s) who need to apologize are those who spread it as truth without vetting.  It's pretty obvious from all his other Medium stories, it was absurdist satire.  #ladybugs https://t.co/8SCJHDV9Iy

author: litosandoval
text: Giggle fits over #ladybugs Not just because of the story that prompted it, but that no one understood that it was satire.  It's not real!!  Look at the artist/author's other Medium posts!

author: litosandoval
text: I keep trying to pull out of politics, but Nov 2020 SF candidates keep calling.  I let it go to VM.  Sorry, I mean it about not wanting to get involved.  That being said I do have opinions who all is running.  If yer remotely interested, you can DM me.

text: The very same reasons I hate Quentin T’s movies and their alternative histories . But also like QT movies, an amazing cast. Patti Lupone and Holland Taylor were just brilliant in their roles.

author: litosandoval
text: And while i could suspend belief and indulge through most of the series, the last episode was too far fetched and harder to accept given the realities of then and today.

author: litosandoval
text: #HollywoodNetflix Overall i enjoyed it, but the last episode actually annoyed me. The fantasy just couldn’t override reality.

author: litosandoval
text: #ThrowbackThursday #TonyDeCarlo 2000?  Me and the first piece of art I ever purchased, Tony De Carlo's "Revealing Isidro"  Fell in love after seeing it on a wall in the artist's home while Jaime Cortez was looking for cover art for the "Virgins, Guerrillas y Locas" anthology. https://t.co/iXjpbmI9v4

author: litosandoval
text: Even while working from home, GLBT Historical Society staff continue to create new opportunities for exploring LGBTQ history. I’m supporting them on #GivingTuesdayNow because preserving and sharing our history matters! Join me at https://t.co/tsRURwZdof.
